text: uh hi everyone it's Anthony witch Tano
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of this new
Sam Smith album Gloria this is the
newest and fourth full-length LP from UK
pop singer and songwriter Sam Smith who
is having quite an interesting album
cycle this time around having dropped
one of the biggest singles of their
career Unholy featuring Kim Petrus which
recently went platinum uh won a Grammy
also uh becoming attached with it at the
Grammys was a performance that got a lot
of people whipped up into a satanic
Panic personally I never really got a
lot out of Sam Smith's work outside of
the hits but clearly they've been
maturing as an artist over the years and
becoming more bold as a person so I was
curious to see if that would manifest
into a more interesting album this time
around because while Sam does have a
great and emotive voice rarely am I
Blown Away by their songwriting ideas
however initially anyway I was pretty
impressed with the introspective
intimate and sensual angles that Gloria
was hitting simply put this is a record
about love but not in a vacuum as many
of the songs on this record have a queer
perspective to them that is very well
aware of the increasingly hostile and
bigoted world that it exists in which
comes through via some of the interludes
as well as the inner workings of the
lyrics here for sure this album is
making some pretty big and essential
statements for the Paradigm we're
currently living in which is why I was
so surprised to see the tracklist of
this thing running so scanned and for
the music to consistently be so low
impact the opening ballad love me more
features a moving sentiment about loving
yourself appreciating yourself more Sam
fights off all the criticism and
self-loathing that may have been eating
at them over the years setting that to
some sweet gospel style organs which are
nice but then the pre-packaged vocal
Melody and very Bland hip-hop beat are
kind of another story sure it's an easy
and pleasant listen but it's also a
lacking one as well as the whole thing
feels like the musical equivalent to a
super wholesome meme you might catch on
Facebook or a motivational poster
something to kind of put you into a
positive mindset before you go out into
the soul-sucking world happy thoughts
happy thoughts happy thoughts happy
thoughts happy thoughts in a candy
coated shell I get a lot more out of the
retaliatory Vibe coming off of no God
where Sam throws shots at people who uh
would be hateful and bigoted and
judgmental toward those who are just
trying to live their life I actually
like the way Sam portrays the opposition
here as being so unbending and unwilling
to change and I think the Moody
laid-back beat and chords of the cut are
tasteful as well and set a really nice
tone for Sam's voice the song lose you I
do appreciate for playing Into The
Narrative of the interlude cut that
precedes it but it's still kind of a by
the Numbers heartbroken dance pop Anthem
Sam's attempts at elevating these
Throwback House Vibes with some extra
strings and chorus vocals only go so far
the longing for romance painted in the
lyrics of the song Perfect is okay Sam
has some stunning vocal lines on the
hook of the track too but again in my
opinion this one essentially puts one
more bland tune and instrumental on the
board Unholy again I assume most people
watching this review have heard it it is
a fun Sinister Bop that stands out like
a sore thumb in this track list because
it's really the only cut that is so damn
over the top with such a hulking hulking
beat it's a bulky Banger that
soundtracks a pretty simple story about
a guy who is going out and not keeping
his business clean being naughty being a
bad boy he's getting hot at The Body
Shop doing something Unholy he's left
the kids at home which I I think that
was a good decision they should probably
stay there I like the track but even
though it sounds as big as it does
there's not really a whole lot to say
about it other than that it's wholesome
good salacious entertainment how to cry
is a really great vulnerability Anthem
with another stunning vocal performance
I find the whole sentiment of the track
to be moving even if at the end of the
day there is kind of an ick equation
based formula going on between The
Melodies and the structure of the track
then from here we move into a very so-so
second half of the record the sexy and
sensual six shots definitely does its
job as a lovemaker but it's pretty in
one ear and out the other I'm not really
sure if there's uh any purpose for this
track other than being the soundtrack to
something else gimmy's cross-cultural
mix of influences isn't too bad but what
I dislike about it even though that
there are cool Jesse Reyes and coffee
features in the mix the beat is so
stripped back in color deficient there's
not really a whole lot to it that feels
like it's coming from outside of U.S
borders other than just the groove like
it doesn't need to be this washed out we
can add a bit of spice into the recipe
know I'm not here to make friends is an
Unapologetic disco number about once
again finding love and I guess it sounds
okay I wouldn't call the instrumentation
bad or tacky or tasteless it's certainly
not deaf to Classic disco Aesthetics but
given the flood of disco revivalism
we've heard over the past 10 years this
is nowhere near like you know the top of
the line in terms of what we've heard
again it's not terrible but it feels a
little lost in the Crowd by contrast
Gloria is one of the most beautiful and
stunning sounds I've heard on any Sam
Smith album ever the gospel inspired
group vocal passages throughout it are
amazing but but but it's barely even a
song it's kind of just a glorified
interlude that doesn't even span two
minutes so then we have the closer uh
Who We Love featuring Ed Sheeran which
narratively does a good job of tying the
album's overall sentiments on love up
but the distant pianos and beat don't
really have much bite and if if you were
going into this thing hoping to hear
some kind of uh unique interesting vocal
chemistry going on between Sam and Ed
you're going to be sorely disappointed
but look forward to hearing this track
play at a friend or a family member's
wedding in the next few years or so so I
think this record overall has some heart
to it some decent intentions some good
vocal performances too but outside of a
few standout moments this very short
record is packed to the brim with
generic songwriting and instrumentation
that is painfully average in just about
every way imaginable so while I do like
what Sam Smith is trying to deliver in
terms of a message and what Sam brings
also to the table in terms of vocal
chops it would be great to hear an album
of production and songwriting that
sounds as unique or is instantly
recognizable as they do because I'm
really not getting that on much of
Gloria feeling a strong five to a light
six on this one transition have you
given this record to listen did you love
it did you hate it what would you rate
it you're the best you're the best what
should I review next hit the like feel
like Please Subscribe and please don't
cry hit the Bell as well over here next
to my head is another video you can

Sam Smith
forever
